TopicTitle: [1.0.5] [RELEASE 0.8] Sido's Urania System : 7 new planets and 8 moons !

Articles.Content: For me it work well with and without sentar.
pasting just at the bottom of the cloud.cfg they wont appear. i have it in both and they appeared dont know if just putting in user cloud settings.cfg will have them appear

Yes that's what i say, you must paste the code at the bottom of your clouds mod files.

Happy to see that's it work.

have a good game.
actualy it says just the cloud.cfg it says nothing about user settings.

actualy it says just the cloud.cfg it says nothing about user settings.

I talk about files

And there's no "cloud.cfg" in the boulderco files. it's for the example.

if you don't understand that for see a cloud layer you must edit the both files i can't help you.

I made the aurora, and the separate zip cause an admin ask for it and i think it was a good idea.

if you don't want to edit anything, you download all the pack, you merge the folder when your OS ask for it and that's all.

Thanks.

Thanks for all other who made me a lot of constructive feedback by private message.

It's really interesting and, i'll try to put all your advice in a futur update.

keep tuning.

Sid

Ok slight bug. I downloaded the planet pack Jan 27. Well today I redownloaded the pack and installed it and the DV needed to get from Kerbin to orbit seem to have doubled. Reinstalled all version, bug gone.
One last question: does it break saves?

It's seem that there's an ArgumentException involving FAR and a dictionary object. That's how it stores the properties of other planet's atmospheres, and it list the bodies using indices based on the FlightGlobals index for that body. PlanetFactory isn't changing that, so multiple bodies are getting the same index, which causes FAR to break.

I'll made an update by changing index for custom systems to avoid the conflict in the next update

Also have you fixed this now?

Also have you fixed this now?

Probably not as im guesiing thats why my DV doubled for Kerbin when I installed the newer version.

Also have you fixed this now?

It's ok in the next version, maybe at the end of this week.

This is not my only project so this one is not my priority.

But i fixed this in the next update (0.6)

How hard is it to add new science defines for new planets? Is it basically just adding the moon/planet name into the current science defines with the new name and adding the text needed? I'm thinking of adding some basic ones just so I get credit for orbiting these celestial bodies.
